meanings.definition: People who write glosses or explanatory notes on texts.
meanings.sent1: The glossators diligently added explanations to the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often refer to glossators when studying historical documents.
meanings.sent3: The group of glossators had a friendly competition to see who could write the most detailed notes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a team of glossators, carefully dissecting and explaining every detail.
meanings.sent5: The young students were like eager glossators, eager to annotate and clarify the text.

meanings.definition: The act of writing glosses or explanatory notes on texts.
meanings.sent1: The glossators' work involved analyzing and interpreting the text.
meanings.sent2: The importance of glossators lies in their ability to make complex texts easier to understand.
meanings.sent3: In the library, the shelves were filled with books on glossators and their methods.
meanings.sent4: Her pen moved swiftly, like a glossators' quill, adding insights to the margins.
meanings.sent5: The classroom buzzed with the energy of young glossators, eager to annotate and explain.
